author: Graham Sargent
comment: Most useful features, like genetics, are paywalled.

author: Mohamed Ibrahim
comment: Good app but there seems to be a bug with entering repetitions in metric units. Obviously 8 Leg presses with 70kg are considered to be very week. I think the app interprets the 70 as pounds. There is no way to tell

author: Marcella King
comment: Good functionality
title: Great app

author: HENDRY ARY SURYAWAN ANDIKA DEWANDARU
comment: Proses download
title: Try

author: Kyla Diamond
comment: I'm a tai chi teacher and can use this for monitoring the overall fitness of my students as they learn. Great app
title: Great

author: lala lupsy
comment: Cant open profile. Not working
title: . Its terrible

author: Jon Cowan
comment: Dev updated to work on kit Kat. Runs smooth.
title: App looks promising.

author: Gwendolyn Johnson
comment: Works well for keeping health data
title: Good interface

author: Riddhi G
comment: I like it and would like to see more health apps from the developer.
title: Great app

author: silrak 7
comment: Love the app,  has more features than the other health monitors out there
title: Great app

author: Stephanie Browne
comment: If been experimenting with lots of fitness apps and this is the first to prove really useful. The real time tracking with e sensors is a bonus and the heart rate training zones is good for anyone using a pulse monitor.
title: Excellent

author: Elyse April
comment: I work with shelters for women and children and this app provides a great tool for evaluating their health and recommending further interventions. Happy to have discovered it.
title: Excellent

author: Estabrooks Kyle
comment: Touch interface works, but when trying input text into the text box areas, it doesn't respond and the keyboard does not pop up. App is rendered useless.

reply.author: BioStatus Health
reply.content: In previous versions of BioStatus the text boxes could only be activated by touching the left most side of the input field. It has since been updated and users can touch anywhere on the input field for the soft keyboard to appear. Thank you for bringing this to our attention.

title: TextText input doesn't work.

author: Alyssa King
comment: Simply layout with powerfull features, would recommend to anyone wanting to monitor their health. The risk prediction system is a great feature and puts it in a class by itself.
title: Best of its kind

author: Tracey Janke
comment: Gets stuck when installing heart rate monitor and cannot get past it. Good for increasing stress levels. Update -  given 4 stars due to developer contacting me.  Have decided to use another app so will not pursue a fix.

reply.author: BioStatus Health
reply.content: Hello Tracey, as the lead programmer for Heath Pad I would be like to find a remedy for the issue you were experiencing with the app. If you would be willing to contact me directly at support@biostatushealth.com I am confident we can figure out what was causing the problem and issue a patch for it. Thank You

title: Annoying waste of time.

author: Usagi Hinorei
comment: While  I can type info into the textboxes, it's difficult to get it to switch focus to the next textbox. For example I type in my age and hit next.. it does not respond. I try to exit out of the keyboard and it doesn't respond either.  Or I will click one of the radial buttons and it refocuses on the age text box. I also am unable to save my profile at all, I tap the save button but nothing happens. I have a google nexus 5. I am very disappointed at not being able to try out this app.
title: Unable to use

author: Steven Forsyth
comment: How are going to use this when it does not do anything really
title: Hate it

comment: One of the best health tracking interfaces i have seen
